snippet: Amid talk of compromise, President Obama and Speaker John A. Boehner both indicated unchanged stances on this issue, long a point of contention.
abstract: Pres Obama will insist that tax increases on affluent Americans be part of any agreement to avoid a year-end fiscal crisis, setting up a possible confrontation with Congressional Republicans who say they will oppose a rise in tax rates for the rich; pledge comes among other signs of confidence in his first appearance since his electoral victory.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: Amid talk of compromise, President Obama and Speaker John A. Boehner both indicated unchanged stances on this issue, long a point of contention.

headline.seo: Obama Says Vote Validates His Efforts on Taxes
headline.main: Obama to Insist on Tax Increase for the Wealthy
headline.print_headline: Obama to Insist on Tax Increase for the Wealthy
